availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Phillip Burton Thompson (Mercer County, Kentucky, attorney. (CSA))

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, attorney. Harrodsburg, Kentucky native. Son of John B. and Nancy Robards Thompson. Married to Martha A. Montgomery Thompson. Father of Davis M, John Burton, and Philip Burton Thompson, Junior. Served as a captain in the Mexican American War. Attorney in Mercer County, Kentucky in 1850. Attorney in Mercer County, Kentucky in 1860. Representative Lawyer in Mercer in 1860. Fought for the Confederacy during the Civil War. Representative of Mercer County at the Russellville Convention of the Provisional Government of Kentucky in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer, District 1, p. 247A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer, Harrodsburg, p. 686.
The Biographical Cyclopedia of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, (Chicago: Donohue & Henneberry, 1896): 166-168.
